intro: Gymnolaena oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca grass, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant typically has slender, wiry stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Gymnolaena oaxacana is often found in rocky or disturbed soils in arid and semi-arid regions.
